intro: Lycium intricatum subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf boxthorn, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, spiny stems and elliptical leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for birds and some mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
